She was induced with cytotec x 2 and given an epidural. She was noted to have fetal bradycardia and was taken for an urgent c-section. She had an uncomplicated c-section until about 1 hour following her c-section she was noted to be passing large clots. She was given cytotec, but continued to have bleeding and was then taken to the OR. In the OR she was given hemabate, methergine. pitocin, and cytotec. Her uterus was noted to be atonic and D&C was performed, but due to persistent atonic uterus, laparotomy and subsequent supracervical hysterectomy performed. Laparotomy revealed a hemoperitoneum and boggy, enlarged, atonic uterus. Her operative course was notable for IVF 4200, EBL 4 L with urine output 500 with 5 units pRBC, 4 units of FFP, 1 bag of platelet as well as 500 albumin. She required brief neosynephrine for SBP 60s, then was weaned off with subsequent elevated SBP to 150s-170s. She was also reportedly given vercuronium during the procedure. . She arrived to the [**Hospital Unit Name 153**] intubated and sedated on propofol. She had her 5th unit of pRBC hanging at time of transfer.
